Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.commands

Interface Command

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddBook, AddPatron, BorrowBook, Help, ListBooks, ListPatrons, LoadGUI, RenewBook, ReturnBook, ShowBook, ShowPatron
public interface Command
The Command interface models an action that occurs as a result of a command given by the user.

The interface provides the execute(Library, LocalDate) function which must be implemented by all the objects that implement the Command interface.

In addition, all classes that implement this interface, can have a constructor to initialise additional objects (if needed) for the execution of the command. See AddBook as an example of a class that needs a constructor and ListBooks as an example of one that doesn't.

See Also:
execute(Library, LocalDate), AddBook, ListBooks

  • Field Summary

    Fields

    The message to be shown to the user when the help command is given.

  • Field Details

    • HELP_MESSAGE

      static final java.lang.String HELP_MESSAGE
      The message to be shown to the user when the help command is given.

      See Help command for more details.

      See Also:
      Help, Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • execute

      void execute​(Library library, java.time.LocalDate currentDate) throws LibraryException
      The function that executes the Command given by the user.

      All classes that implement the Command interface must provide an implementation of this method. the function takes as argument a Library object containing all the books and patrons that exist on the library system and uses it to make the changes instructed from the command given by the user.

      The function also takes a LocalDate object with the current date to be used by commands that need this information when executed (e.g. when a book is borrowed or returned ).

      Parameters:
      library - the library object to perform actions based on the command given
      currentDate - an object holding the current date
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if something goes wrong with the execution of the command
      See Also:
      Library, LocalDate, BorrowBook, ReturnBook
